intro: Careya australis, commonly known as the Australian careya, is a flowering plant native to Australia and New Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and satinwood trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Careya australis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in coastal and lowland areas.
